file_content.text: I know that code is right! Why aren't my escape passages opening?
The answer just broke into your command center.
I'll give you one guess.
Strong enough to demolish my forces and smart enough to take out my tech.
You're not going anywhere.
I should have been able to just do it without thinking about it.
You can't count on technology to save your skin.
Computers are unreliable.
Maybe all security is an illusion.
When the alarms sounded, I knew there was trouble coming.
Don't strike. I'm a secret Imperial agent working directly for Darth Baras.
That's not news to me. You discover and keep secrets for Baras that he uses to gain power and control others.
I already know.
My work keeps rogue Imperial elements from destabilizing the Empire. But that's just part of what I do.
That's worse than being Republic.
I hate Darth Baras.
So you're one of the rogue Sith I help Darth Baras keep in line?
You might oppose him, but surely you wouldn't jeopardize the war?
You'd say anything to save your neck.
What if I don't believe you?
You must listen. The service I perform for Baras is critical.
I collect information that helps keep rogue Imperial elements from destabilizing the Empire. But that's just the start...
I'm essential in the fight for Corellia. I steer Republic-aligned resistance forces into battles they can't win. Shut me down and we lose this war.
You are my enemy's spy, so you must perish.
Baras's people die. [Kill him]
Cooperate and you may survive this encounter.
Work with me.
You collect secrets for Darth Baras. That must end. Give up the information you harbor for him.
There's no future in denying Baras.
I'm systematically tearing Baras down, and I'm still here.
I defy him.
I see.
Does your future seem bright when you look at me, Senks?
As opposed to now?
It seems you hold all the cards.
Every regime eventually falters. I'd be wise to get out before the towers start crumbling.
I'll upload the files.... There. Wiped from my system, and relinquished to you. Does this earn your mercy?
Sit still while I authenticate your information....
I must verify this.
Darth Vowrawn, I'm transmitting the materials from Colonel Senks's files.
Excellent. Let me look them over....
Yes, this is the leverage Darth Baras has over my fellow Dark Council members. Now they are free of him.
Does this mean I get to keep breathing and winning the war for Corellia?
I leave that decision to my formidable friend. What do you say--does Colonel Senks live or die?
Senks, meet your new master.
He serves you now.
You heard him, Colonel.
You heard her, Colonel.
Your tenure under Darth Baras has ended. You answer to me now. Understood?
Absolutely. I am yours to command. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must reprogram my security systems.
He is a Baras collaborator and must perish.
He dies. [Kill Senks]
Ugh!
I can't fault your desire to destroy him. We will find other ways to turn the tide of war here.
Continue your work, Senks. But if I hear that you are aiding Darth Baras in any way, I will hunt you down.
Live.
I will cut off all contact with Baras. I guarantee it.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I must repair my security systems.
Good work, my new friend. You are proving we can tear Baras down without compromising the Empire.
I have news, but as I said--Baras likely has that place bugged. Contact me when you clear the compound.
How valuable are you to the Empire if you turn so easily?
Too easy.
You are fearsome, and I want to help the Empire achieve victory. I can't do that if I'm dead.
Does this mean I can continue my efforts to win this war?
Vowrawn is your master now. And if I hear you ever work for Darth Baras again, you're dead.
You answer to a new Darth.
We are in agreement. I will answer only to Darth Vowrawn, my lord.
I want to defeat the Republic as much as anyone.
Keep up the good work.
I'm relieved that we are both patriots.
Now, I return to the fight. But first, I must reprogram my security systems.
The Empire will have to get along without you.
No. [Kill Senks]
Weak-willed fool.
You're spineless. [Kill Senks]
No!
That was your last mistake.
Wrong answer. [Kill Senks]
Everyone's expendable. I'll take that risk.
I don't care. [Kill him]
No!
